header.title: A financial coach for everyone
header.description: Studies show that financial coaching is extremely effective in getting Americans on the path to financial health, so why do so few have access to it? We worked directly with the communities we hope to serve to create a suite of digital guides that mirror the in-person coaching process. And we’re giving them away for free.

features.title: 47% of Americans don’t have $400 in emergency savings. We designed digital solutions from their perspective.
features.pullquote: "Our clients could use this in the months between their appointments, or in times of crisis."

benefits.title: Reach more people
benefits.description: Guides remove multiple barriers that keep people from receiving help.

benefits.title: 24/7 Support
benefits.description: A digital guide can provide round-the-clock support when in-person isn’t available.

benefits.title: Customizable
benefits.description: We can adjust tools for things like titles, languages, links to resources and more.

benefits.title: Free to Access
benefits.description: The entire suite of digital guides are free and available for everyone to use.

benefits.title: Self-Service
benefits.description: Money is difficult to talk about, and it’s hard to ask for help when you need it.

benefits.title: Simple & Personalized
benefits.description: Guides start at a recognizable problem and then lead users to a personalized solution.

benefits.title: Actionable Solutions
benefits.description: Long-term action plans are broken down into bite-sized, achievable steps.

contact.title: We can help you utilize Steps.
contact.description: Our team has been actively working with organizations that could benefit from the tools we’ve created. If you feel you could partner with us, reach out and let’s start the conversation.

mainpage.title: Free digital tools for low income communities
mainpage.stepstagline: THERE ARE A NUMBER OF WAYS YOU CAN USE OUR GUIDES

trythempage.title: Share them directly with your clients
trythempage.description: Take a look at our collection of guides, try them out and share them with your clients. We would love to hear your feedback as we continue to improve them.

infobox.text: Each digital guide tackles a common money problem by mirroring the in-person coaching process and linking users to resources and action-plans. The experiences provide step-by-step help and personalized action plans for things like paying rent, buying food, rebuilding credit and more.

collabpage.title: Let's help you make your own
collabpage.description: We can work with you to make a guide that links your community to local resources and can be flexible to things like language and location.

infobox.text: NerdWallet recognized an opportunity to help their audience with specific financial issues, so we partnered with them to make a suite of guides under their brand.

codepage.title: Customize them yourself
codepage.description: Our original source code is freely available for anyone to use and distribute.

infobox.text: With code access you can customize, translate, localize or otherwise edit the guides to fit your needs.

mainpage.title: Human-centered design starts with people
mainpage.description: Our research begins with the people we hope to serve and the experts, non-profit organizations, and service providers that work within those communities. Once we begin to design from their perspective, we start to identify where we could have the greatest impact in scaling a digital solution.

videos.title: Money is more than just numbers
Money is difficult to talk about
Actionable steps are needed to reach goals
Disadvantages compound and it is hard to get ahead

ideationpage.title: Ideation
ideationpage.description: The next phase of our design process is about ideas, lots of them. We spend time thinking about all the ones that are too crazy to work and too crazy not to try. Then we invite some of the same people we met during our initial research to tell us what they think. This helps us refine our thinking and narrow down solid directions.

infobox.title: MINUTE APP
infobox.description: Minute app is an early concept from the ideation phase for STEPS. It focused on providing easy access to affordable childcare through a user’s social network. Childcare, we found, was a heavy burden that impacts household income tremendously.

convergencepage.title: Convergence
convergencepage.description: When we have an idea that feels right, we create a series of prototypes in a few directions based in common threads from our research. Then we send them into the world for people to utilize. In this phase we gain valuable insights about the demographics of our audience and let their preferences dictate user experience for the next iteration.

infobox.title: DOUBLECHECK.ORG
infobox.description: We launched Facebook ads to test 3 prototypes under a “text-a-coach” delivery method. DoubleCheck.org was the most successful, however all 3 gave us a better understanding of who exactly our audience was, what their core needs are, and to which design attributes they preferred.

adoptionpage.title: Adoption
adoptionpage.description: Once we have digital tools we know the community will embrace, we can’t wait to share them with everyone. Our focus then becomes about finding partnerships and strategies that will continue to improve them, and make them freely accessible to as many people and organizations as possible.

contact.statement: We believe that digital design has the power to move millions of Americans from financial distress to financial freedom, one step at a time.
contact.tagline: Join us and share in our vision

about.title: Who we are
about.description: Steps is a program of IDEO.org, a nonprofit working to improve the lives of people in poor and vulnerable communities through design. We are supported by JPMorgan Chase and backed by an Advisory Council of trusted non-profit organizations.

partners.headline: Advisory Council
partners.description: The Advisory Council is a group of 18 nonprofit and technology partners with unique perspectives and expertise on the needs and experiences of low-income communities in the U.S. They have been working with us to provide feedback on product creation, design, content and distribution strategy for all digital products within the Steps Program.
